article.title: Ubuntu Help System
article.para: Welcome to your Ubuntu help system! This is your first stop for finding information about how to use any aspect of your Ubuntu system. Click on the appropriate section to find information.

listitem.para: An introduction to Ubuntu and its philosophy;
Switching to Ubuntu from other operating systems;
Common questions for those new to Ubuntu;
How to add and remove software from Ubuntu;
Playing sound and video;
Connecting to the internet;
Setting up server applications;
Using all types of programs in Ubuntu.

article.para: Maintain and Administer your System - including:

listitem.para: Keeping Ubuntu up to date;
Security;
Configuring the system.
Printers;
Graphics cards;
Adding any other hardware to Ubuntu.
Introduction to Ubuntu - an explanation of the Ubuntu philosophy and roots.
Switching to Ubuntu - What you need to know if moving to Ubuntu from another operating system.
Adding, Removing and Updating Programs- How to manage software in Ubuntu.
Using your Desktop - including how to manage files, and using assistive technologies.
Sound and Video - including MP3 and other formats.
Internet & Networking - Connecting to the Internet as well as your home or office network.
Games - A list of great games for Ubuntu.
Eye Candy - Ubuntu themes and artwork.
Business Environment - Configuring Ubuntu for use in business environments.
Servers - Setting up web servers, file servers, and more.
Programming - Creating software in Ubuntu.
OS Emulation - Running other Operating Systems inside Ubuntu.
Accessibility - Making Ubuntu easier to use for those with physical or visual challenges.
System Administration - System administration, configuration & maintenance tasks within Ubuntu.
Security - Security tools and best-practices.
Upgrading Ubuntu - Upgrading from one Ubuntu release to another (from Breezy 5.10 to Dapper 6.06 LTS for example).
Ubuntu Hardware Support - Main hardware support page.
Drives and Partitions - Setting up disk drives and storage devices.
Video - Setting up graphics hardware.
Keyboard and Mouse - Setting up your keyboard and mouse.
Network, wireless & internet devices - Setting up networking & internet devices.
Printers - Setting up and using your printer.
Sound - Setting up and using sound devices.
ThinClients - Setting up and using thin client architectures.
